location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 92: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell reports that he has received an autographed note, dated 2 March 1850, from the Prince Governor of Fars, which states that the Prince has despatched a mohussil to Hajee Khan, the Chief of Dashtee, with orders regarding the affair of the Futh ool Kheyrbugla [buggalow]. Hennell writes that he presumes that these orders refer to the exaction of a fine of 300 tomans from the Commander of the vessel for bringing slaves to Bushire.
